refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns a fully qualified table name.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The complete_table_name() can be used to make a fully qualified table name from non-qualified one, i.e. the qualifier and owner will be added if they are missing.

refsect2.title: tablename
refsect2.para: The table name to be retrieved.

refsect2.title: mode
refsect2.para: If this mode parameter is set to 1 this function will first look-up the supplied tablename for a match in the system tables. If a match is found the full name will be returned, if the table is not found the function will continue as if the mode were set to 0.
When the mode parameter is 0 the result will be generated using the current qualifier and current SQL user account names.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: A string will be returned containing the fully qualified table name.

entry.errorname: Function complete_table_name needs a string as argument 1, not an arg of type [type]
Function complete_table_name needs an integer as argument 2, not an arg of type [type]

example.title: Using the complete_table_name() function
example.para: This simple example shows retrieval of a fully qualified table name using the complete_table_name() function from ISQL. In the first case the table name supplied is a system table, in the second case the table does not exist and the result is generated based on the users details:
example.screen:
SQL> use WS;
Done. -- 4 msec. SQL> select complete_table_name('SYS_DAV_RES', 1); callret VARCHAR _______________________________________________________________________________
WS.WS.SYS_DAV_RES
1 Rows. -- 1 msec.
SQL> select complete_table_name('SYS_DAV_RES__', 1); callret VARCHAR _______________________________________________________________________________
WS.DBA.SYS_DAV_RES__
1 Rows. -- 1 msec.
